author: lego613master
title: Knight of Fire!!
review:
To start off this review, I must recommend Furno XL to you. He is quite cool, both in looks and in pieces. He however is slightly lacking in the playability area. He is very good for posing, though, and it is quite easy to make him look epic! His sword is, for me, definitely the main attraction, followed by the cape.

Pros

  • Sword
  • TriOrange armor pieces
  • Cape
  • Shield pieces, easily adapted to many uses
  • Good building experience with many new techniques I have not seen before in Hero Factory. Believe me, I have a lot of Heroes + Villains and know how they are made!
  • Most of his pieces would work wonders on Technic constructions

Cons

  • The new heads are completely featureless
  • When you take the clear headpiece off, his helmet looks horrible underneath
  • The cape is used only to cover a horribly unarmored and skimpy back
  •  

So, that's what I think about the set. Go to the store, and pick him up. You won't regret it! 

UNITY DUTY DESTINY

author: robowarrior_prime
title: Best hero XL yet
review:
Pros

  • Good body proportions compared to previous XL offerings thus far
  • Printed helmet piece
  • Interesting upper torso build
  • Weapons look convincing
  • Flame pieces
  • Very stable despite small-ish feet (previous XLs had bigger feet)

Cons

  • Shield fixes directly on ball joint, no hand. Shield gets in the way sometimes due to this.
  • Out of scale with other heroes (with ref to cartoon)

author: Hfmasters
title: What I think of Furno XL
review:
Pros

Has nice flame pieces

Has nice playability

Has a well done torso and stands well

Has more flexibility then other XL sized Hero Factory sets

Cons

Cape gets in the way
